channel.title: Portforwarding Issue Rep++
channel.description:
I am have the most angering port forwarding issues. I have tried everything and I am on the verge of pulling my fucking brains out. I have a Linksys router. I have done everything, looked up every tutorial etc.. Fist I enter my default gateway into my address bar then username and password. After that I am inside my router and I proceed to application and gaming. I then enter under port range forwarding the "RSPS" name, 43594 on both ports, I have made the protocol for "both" and "tcp" neither have worked. I have completely disabled my firewall along with allowing the ports through them, and still canyouseeme says that they cannot see me on port 43594 because "connection has timed out" Please help repping++
I would be more than grateful if someone would teamview with me although only if I feel comfortable.

@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

let me try :eek:

pm me or add on skype

item.title: Portforwarding Issue Rep++
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

aquatizscape:

Care to share what the issue was?

At first it was believed to be my EVs, but it turns out my router/computer is incompatible with port forwarding correctly without timing out.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding Issue Rep++
item.dc:creator: @nolan2131 nolan2131
item.description:
@nolan2131 wrote:

aquatizscape:

I think you have a program open already that is using 43594. That’s what my issue was a few years back. Hope i helped!

Thanks for your input, the problem has been rectified.

Read full topic
